result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben A Garcia

records.addlTxt: for Substitution of Attorneys filed by Atty. Christopher Carson. **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 8/15/22 - Approved; Attorney Carson to send in an order.*

9:55 AM Defendant Ruben A Garcia in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson as friend to the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Atty Carson to file a Notice for Subsitution.
Defense has received an offer.
Defense requests time to negotiate with the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Attorney Christopher Carson
Hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:39 AM Defendant Ruben A Garcia in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Rasmussen states he has received written discovery, however has not received eletronic discovery or an offer and requests a new status date.
The State states there is yet an offer in the file.
The Court will adjourn the matter and requests attorney Rasmussen to reach out to the State to get both an offer and eletronic discovery.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:34 AM Defendant Ruben A Garcia in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty. Tyler Rasmussen.

Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:03 PM Defendant Ruben A Garcia in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states that he is going to hire attorney John German.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 05/09/2022.
Hearing on May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of emergency purposes or if they initiate the contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store to include a casino.

03:07 PM Defendant Ruben A Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as he declined.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and the Court reads the criminal complaint to the defendant on the record.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
